definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: He had pressed the button before we could stop him.
sentences.chinese: 我们还没来得及阻止他，他已经按了电钮。

sentences.english: The machine will start instantly you press the button.
sentences.chinese: 你一按电钮机器就会开动。

sentences.english: If you need anything, just press this button.
sentences.chinese: 你若需要什么，就请按这个电钮。

sentences.english: All I did was(to)press the button.
In front of the table, on the wall, was an electric pushbutton, which controlled the lights.
sentences.chinese: 桌前的墙壁上有一个控制光线的电钮。

sentences.english: Push the button if you want the elevator.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要乘电梯，就按电钮。

sentences.english: The machine will start instantly after you press the button.
sentences.chinese: 你一按电钮机器就会开动。

sentences.english: By standing on tip-toe, I managed to reach the button.
sentences.chinese: 我踮起脚才勉强够着电钮。

sentences.english: He pushed the starter button, and the engine came to life with a roar.
sentences.chinese: 他按了一下启动电钮，发动机就轰的一声运转起来。

sentences.english: All you have to do is to press the button.
sentences.chinese: 你只要把电钮一按就行了。

sentences.english: If that sounds too technical, a Blog is a push-button publishing system.
sentences.chinese: 如果这听起来太技术，博客是一个电钮出版系统。

sentences.english: You can stop the machine by pressing this button.
sentences.chinese: 你按这个电钮就能使机器停下来。

sentences.english: Just press the button and the machine will start.
sentences.chinese: 只要一按电钮，机器就会开动。

definition: to press down/to press a button
to pull out/to pull a lever
gangway/ramp (to board a ship or plane)
aerial work platform (e.g. cherry picker or scissor lift)/lift/elevator
